intro: Taraxacum glaucolivaceum, commonly known as the blue-green dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, blue-green leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in early spring. Native to eastern North America, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. The plant produces a distinctive, hollow stem that supports its flowering head, and it is known for its ability to spread via wind-dispersed seeds. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important member of its habitat.
